intro: Eriostemon dentatus, commonly known as the serrated eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Eriostemon dentatus is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
